text:
(1) Recreation--baseball: a local baseball diamond in the Bronx, on the east side of Soundview Avenue near Newman Avenue.

P. L. Sperr

(2) A local baseball field in the shadow of the Polo Grounds (extreme left) and the 155th Street viaduct, seen from the Harlem River Driveway. The view is east and shows the "El" on Eighth Avenue and the Yankee Stadium (center) circular structure) in the Bronx. Across the latter is the Bronx County Court House. Also shown is the Macombs Dam Bridge.

P. L. Sperr
title: Recreation and hobbies - Baseball.

title: Recreation and hobbies - Baseball.

text:
Eighth Avenue, at West 155th Street, showing various aspects of this locale. View No. 1 is northward along the line of the Avenue showing the "El" trains thereupon. At the left is the baseball park, the Polo Grounds. View No. 2 is eastward showing the viaduct carrying 155th Street over this point. In the background is the Bronx shore of the Harlem River. Beyond the 155th Street Bridge appears the super structures of the Yankee Stadium and the new Borough Hall Building. No. 3 is limited to the viaduct entrances to the "El" at the left and the Street at the right. The view is northward. Note High Bridge is the distance.

June 5, 1940
No's. 1-2-3

P. L. Sperr

8th Ave South from 155th St.

(1) & (2)
Eighth Avenue looking southwards from the 155th Street Viaduct, before and after demolition.

P.L. Speer.

June 5, 1940.
April 10, 1941.

8th Ave South from 155th St.

(1) & (2)
Eighth Avenue looking southwards from the 155th Street Viaduct, before and after demolition.

P.L. Speer.

June 5, 1940.
April 10, 1941.

Eighth Avenue and 155th Street, southeast from Viaduct, showing site of "Father Divines Peace Mission."

P. L. Sperr
April 10, 1940

Eighth Avenue, at West 155th Street, viewing northeastward across the "El" station there, to the Bronx side of the Harlem River. At the left is the Polo Grounds. Crossing the River at about 158th Street, is the New York and Putnam Railroad Bridge. The photographers vantage point is the viaduct forming 155th Street.

P. L. Sperr

VIEW 1; NEG. 2782

June 5, 1940
No's. 1-2-3
